Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Test Intro

Join one of the fastest growing rewards/fintech startups in the world - Benjamin! Backed by Play Ventures and F4 Fund, we're all about making everyday actions rewarding. We're looking for an experienced Data Scientist to help us take things to the next level.

At Benjamin, we give users real cash rewards—what we call MoMos (Money Moments)—for things they're already doing. From playing games and watching ads to everyday card purchases with cash back, we're all about putting money back in people's pockets.

Key Responsibilities:


Lead and conduct comprehensive investigations into the virtual economy and products, employing hypothesis-driven insights and experimentation methods.
Design and implement data science workflows, including experimental design and key statistical methods.
Communicate complex topics effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Utilize statistical programming languages (R, Python, Julia) and SQL to analyze data.
Leverage data engineering tools (dbt, Spark, Snowflake) to manage and process large datasets.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a culture of growth through teaching and knowledge sharing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive business outcomes.
Develop intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, using tools like Hex, Looker, Tableau, or Mixpanel.
Continuously seek out new ideas and data sources, applying a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach to solve ambiguous problems.


Qualifications


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in analytics or data science positions.
Deep understanding of statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing and experimentation.
Proficiency in statistical programming languages (R, Python, Julia) and SQL.
Familiarity with data engineering tools such as dbt, Spark, and Snowflake.
Expertise in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards with tools like Hex, Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Strong communication skills for explaining complex topics.
Passion for mentoring team members and recognizing teaching as a pathway to growth.
Background in gaming and knowledge of the free-to-play business model preferred; similar experience in related industries is also valued.


Modeling Skills:

Extensive experience in developing and implementing:


Predictive Models: Utilizing techniques like regression analysis, time-series forecasting, and ensemble methods.
Machine Learning Algorithms: Designing and deploying algorithms such as decision trees, random forests, gradient boosting, neural networks, and clustering techniques.
Statistical Models: Conducting statistical analysis using methods such as ANOVA, hypothesis testing, and Bayesian inference.


Ideal Candidate:


Proven track record in the virtual economy and products.
Experience in the entertainment or platform industry.
Ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Why Join Us?


Competitive pay: We offer great salaries and bonuses.
Thriving in Hyper-Growth: Immerse yourself in the dynamic environment of a hyper-growth startup, where you'll encounter daily challenges and avenues for professional advancement.
Cutting-Edge Collaboration: Engage with innovative technology and join a fast-paced team known for its forward-thinking approach and commitment to innovation.
Positive Workplace Culture: Experience a professional yet enjoyable atmosphere, where hard work is valued alongside a sense of humor and camaraderie, fostering a fulfilling work environment.


About Benjamin

Benjamin is reshaping the future of cash rewards with a simple idea: everyday actions should earn you cash. Whether you're making a purchase, playing a mobile game, or watching an ad, you get rewarded with Benjamin Money Moments. It's that simple.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data scientist & IA Ops - H/F
Description:
Lincoln Pure Player Data 💡: Depuis 30 ans, nous réinventons l'analyse des données en accompagnant les grandes entreprises dans leur transformation digitale. Experts en Modern BI, Big Data et Science des Données, nous intervenons dans divers secteurs tels que la banque, le retail, les télécoms, l'industrie et la santé.




5 ans d'expérience minimum




Description du poste




🎯 Missions :




Mettre en place et optimiser des pipelines de déploiement CI/CD pour automatiser et industrialiser le cycle de vie des modèles IA.
Gérer le déploiement, la scalabilité et la maintenance des modèles IA en production avec Kubernetes et Docker.
Assurer la fiabilité, la sécurité et la surveillance des infrastructures dédiées à l'IA et la Data Science.
Collaborer avec les Data Scientists et les ingénieurs MLOps pour intégrer efficacement les modèles dans un environnement cloud/hybride.
Améliorer l'architecture des plateformes Data & IA en adoptant les meilleures pratiques DevOps et MLOps.
Optimiser la gestion des données et la performance des modèles dans un contexte de production.




🛡️ Prérequis :




Expérience pratique dans le déploiement et l'industrialisation de modèles IA en production.
Maîtrise de Python et des outils DevOps/MLOps tels que Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD).
Compétences avancées en gestion d'infrastructure cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) et sur des solutions de monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
Connaissance des frameworks de Machine Learning et Data Science (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Expérience avec des bases de données SQL/NoSQL et des outils de gestion de flux de données.
Capacité à travailler en équipe, résolution de problèmes et forte autonomie.




🌟 Avantages :




Environnement dynamique et innovant.
Formations certifiantes et accompagnement personnalisé.
Possibilité de télétravail et horaires flexibles.
Rémunération attractive avec avantages sociaux compétitifs.
Mobilité possible à Lille, Lyon ou Aix-en-Provence.




✨ Processus de recrutement : Deux entretiens (RH et technique).




Si vous êtes passionné par les défis du Data & IA Ops et souhaitez rejoindre une équipe experte et engagée, postulez dès maintenant et participez à la transformation des données chez Lincoln ! 😉

Title: Data Scientist (Junior)
Description:
We are growing our data science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What you will do

Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations

Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data

Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.

Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets

Present information using data visualization techniques

What we are looking for

Scientific background with computational and analytical skills

Strong problem-solving skills

Programming skills with Python and SQL

Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)

Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)

Experience with data visualization tools and packages

A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

~1 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications

Experience working with huge amounts of data

Experience with cloud based web services (e.g., AWS)

Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).

Why Tendam

One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members

Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.

Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!

Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!

Exposure to agile methodologies

Working with senior Data Scientists to accelerate your professional development

Working in a challenging and dynamic industry




Ubicación oficinas: Madrid Capital zona Norte accesible en transporte público (metro, cercanías-Renfe y autobuses urbanos e interubanos).

Horario jornada flexible: de lunes a jueves entrada entre las 7:30 y las 9:30h y salida entre las 17h y las 19h, viernes jornada intensiva y flexibleentrada entre las 7:30 y las 9:30h y salida entre las 13h y las 15h.

Contrato indefinido.

Salario de fijo + variable

Incorporación inmediata (entendiendo que si la persona seleccionada está actualmente trabajando en otra empresa, tendrá que dar el preaviso correspondiente y se coordinará una fecha entre ambas partes que pueda cuadrar).

Description:
Data Scientist – Copenhagen

Salary range: 540,000 - 720,000 DKK annually

Hybrid: 3 days/week in office or on client site




I'm hiring for a Data Scientist at a top global consulting firm ($B+). You'll work on high-impact AI and data projects, owning the process end-to-end, from problem definition to deployment, while collaborating with major clients across Europe.




Requirements:

Danish & English fluency
Minimum MSc in STEM or Quant (PhD preferred)
1-4 years of Data Science experience (ideally consulting)




Expect a dynamic work environment and opportunities for international travel.




Please apply here or contact me directly for more information.

Title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Consultant
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Strong experience with computer vision and deep learning (CNNs, transformers, object detection, segmentation, etc.);
  • Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
  • Experience with image and video processing techniques;
  • Strong knowledge of data preprocessing, augmentation, and feature engineering;
  • Hands-on experience deploying models using Docker, Kubernetes, TensorFlow Serving, or TorchServe;
  • Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and on-premises infrastructure;
  • Familiarity with distributed computing and big data tools (Spark, Dask, Ray);
  • Understanding of CI/CD pipelines, MLOps best practices, and model monitoring;
  • Ability to work with multimodal data (e.g., sensor fusion, geospatial data) is a plus;
  • Advanced English (minimum B2) for effective communication in global environments;
  • Work authorization in Portugal is mandatory.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Hybrid work model;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We call you by your name and we all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company. Isn´t that the best way to improve professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase? We are waiting for you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
GR. SARANTIS S.A. one of the leading Companies in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods sector with leading brands such as SANITAS, NOXZEMA, STR8, BIOTEN, CARROTEN, ORZENE, CLINEA etc.




We are seeking to recruit for the Data & Analytics Department a passionate and energetic Data Scientist, who enjoys problem solving, and turning complex data into actionable insights. Join us and be part of a forward-thinking team that is dedicated to harnessing data to drive innovation, deliver exceptional results, and make a real impact!




Data Scientist

The role reports to the Head of Data & Analytics




Key Accountabilities:

Understands the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of regional commercial and functional leads and their teams
Translates business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support executive decisions and workflows with required information
Coordinates with data consumers (functional and commercial leads) to understand their information needs
Design, build, and optimize BI dashboards, reports, and visualizations to provide actionable insights to stakeholders
Manage and configure BI tools (e.g., Power BI) to meet business requirements and ensure efficient performance
Provide ongoing support to business users, offering training on BI tools and data-driven decision-making techniques across different levels of the organization
Interacts with IT application specialists (e.g., S/4Hana) and external application vendors to understand how information is stored, modeled, and tagged
Develops frameworks and processes to analyze structured and unstructured information collected through different platforms and sources
Works closely with global and regional heads and managers for knowledge sharing, mentoring, and training
Acts as a go-to-person for end users to interpret and use information
Stay up to date with the latest data science techniques, tools, and trends, and apply them to improve existing models and processes




Candidate Profile:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
At least 3 years of professional experience in a data analysis or data science role
Minimum 2 years of experience in extended MS Azure services and PowerBI
Proficient in SQL for data querying and in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, R) for data analysis, automation, and machine learning tasks
Familiarity with data warehousing techniques and ETL processes
Experience in SAP S4 HANA is a plus
Excellent command of English language




Critical competencies for the role:

Strong analytical, and critical thinking
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights, providing strategic recommendations to drive business decisions
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills with emphasis on delivering results under tight deadlines
Problem solving and resourcefulness
Strong communication and influencing skills, ability to cooperate effectively with diverse stakeholders
Flexibility and adaptability







Company Offers:

Competitive remuneration package
Opportunities for career development in a multinational environment
Pleasant and modern working environment in a challenging organization
Continuous learning opportunities
Hybrid working model

If you would like to use your skills and experience in a dynamic and growing multinational company, please send us your CV.

All CV’s will be treated with strict confidentiality.

The company will contact only with candidates that meet the required qualifications and criteria.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Range, we're looking for a Data Scientist to work on our next-generation AI and machine-learning initiatives. Data drives every decision at Range, powering our efforts in DeFi security, ensuring blockchains are safe and compliant, and delivering market insights that influence millions of users worldwide. Your expertise will help redefine blockchain security, anti-fraud, and compliance and set new industry standards leveraged by leading organizations in the industry, such as Circle and Solana. You will also help recover millions of dollars from hacks and protect millions of consumers.




What You’ll Do

Contribute to our AI efforts to automate blockchain intelligence and anomaly detection.
Drive machine learning research to enhance blockchain security and foster sustainable growth.
Design innovative data collection strategies to network risks, monitor user behavior, and track market trends.
Build scalable ML models for risk assessment, forecasting, and anomaly detection.
Collaborate closely with engineering and product teams to deploy robust models into production.
Deliver actionable insights that improve DeFi security and operational efficiency.
Stay at the forefront of industry trends in machine learning and blockchain analytics.




Requirements

At least 2 years of data science experience with a strong focus on machine learning techniques (e.g., Gradient Boosting, LLMs, etc).
Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL, with hands-on experience using LangChain & RAG, alongside statistical and analytical skills.
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Maths, Physics, Engineering, or Data Science.
A genuine interest and love for graphs and graph algorithms.
A self-motivated, curious innovator who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
A collaborative team player with a strong sense of ownership.
A deep passion for blockchain and Web3 technologies.
Experience with DeFi protocols and on-chain data analysis is a plus.




If you're looking for a high-paced, challenging, but incredibly rewarding opportunity, contact us!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Para algunas personas, la tecnología es reto, la innovación es pasión, y la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo es una oportunidad.




Somos una consultora tecnológica que ofrece soluciones globales a las necesidades complejas de las empresas desde otro punto de vista. Escuchamos para crear progreso en nuestro mundo, integrando tecnología y conocimiento.




Desde nuestro área de DATA&IA, buscamos incorporar a un/a Científico de Datos para formar parte del equipo. El objetivo será participar en los diferentes proyectos de IA con el desarrollo de modelos de Machine Learning y soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial. Evaluar la calidad y el significado de los datos. Identificando e interpretando las tendencias y patrones del conjunto de los datos.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Exploración y preparación de datos, asegurando su calidad, integridad y representatividad para la construcción de modelos de Machine Learning.
Desarrollo, entrenamiento y optimización de modelos de IA, aplicando técnicas avanzadas de Machine Learning, Deep Learning y modelado estadístico.
Implementación de soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial en entornos productivos, optimizando el rendimiento y escalabilidad de los modelos.
Investigación y aplicación de nuevas técnicas y algoritmos, explorando metodologías innovadoras para la mejora continua de los modelos y soluciones de IA.
Despliegue y automatización de modelos mediante MLOps y herramientas cloud para facilitar su integración en el ecosistema.




¿En qué perfil pensamos?




2 años de experiencia en proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial
Formación en matemáticas, estadística, informática o similar.
Valorable conocimiento de las siguientes herramientas: Microsoft Azure, programación en Python, R y SQL, conocimiento de LLMs.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y buenas habilidades comunicativas.







¿Qué podemos aportarte?




Contrato Indefinido. Creemos en el desarrollo a largo plazo de de nuestros empleados, por eso ofrecemos estabilidad laboral desde el primer día.
Flexibilidad horaria y conciliación. Fomentamos un entorno de trabajo flexible para que puedas equilibrar tu vida personal y profesional. Además, tenemos jornada intensiva los viernes y durante los meses de verano.
Plan de carrera individualizado. Diseñamos un plan de desarrollo profesional para que puedas alcanzar tus metas y crecer dentro de la empresa.
Programa de retribución flexible (Plan de pensiones, seguro de salud....).
Formarás parte de un equipo donde el trabajo conjunto y la comunicación abierta son la clave para nuestro éxito compartido.




Si has llegado hasta aquí... ¡Queremos conocerte!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
AGILEX, azienda di consulenza informatica, è alla ricerca di:

Data Scientist

La figura sarà inserita per progetti interni o per progetti su commessa da parte dei nostri clienti.

CARATTERISTICHE DEL CANDIDATO:

Sviluppo di modelli di similarità per la classificazione di brevi testi
Esperienza nel ruolo di Data Scientist
Esperienza nello sviluppo e messa in produzione di progetti NLP
Esperienza nello sviluppo in Python
Conoscenza di piattaforme di Cloud Computing
Capacità di scrivere codice robusto e production-oriented, comprensivo di test
Conoscenza base di Kubernetes
Esperienza con l’analisi di testi bancari




COSA OFFRIAMO:

inserimento con contratto d'assunzione: retribuzione e inquadramento saranno commisurati al percorso di studio/lavoro e alle skills dimostrate
Ambiente di lavoro sfidante e collaborativo

Completano il profilo una personalità dinamica e proattiva, buone doti di comunicazione, di pianificazione e organizzazione, ottime doti di problem solving e capacità relazionali e di team working.

L'offerta di lavoro si rivolge ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data & AI, Data Science Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




The team in question is responsible with the development, deployment and monitoring ML/AI models that impact different business areas, such as: Content, Marketplace, Operations, Commercial.

Our role is to provide challenging and suitable projects for data science, infrastructure, data, technologies and to create a safe environment for learning and development. We develop and deploy on-premises and/or on-cloud depending on the project. The trend is towards cloud, development and production, but with yet no deadline. We provide access to Kubernetes cluster with GPU's included, running Docker containers on each task, writing Python and PySpark with internal standards for coding.




What you’ll have to do:




As Machine Learning Engineer in our team, your role is to formulate and argument a hypothesis, to access, clean and aggregate data, train and interpret models, present the result, get feedback and deploy model in production. This implies collaboration with the team members involved in the process, others machine learning engineers, team lead, product owner, analysts, clients and data teams. It is part of our values to help other team members or other teams in the process. It is a non-negotiable value for us.




How we’d like you to be:




In order for you to adapt for the role you need to have appropriate skills for data wrangling with SQL and PySPark, for structured and unstructured data (text), good understanding of ML/AI techniques, such as boosting, transformers and LLM's, on top of strong mathematical and statistical background about mentioned techniques and be able to efficiently write Python code for development and production using versioning control system (Git).

Familiarity with MLOps tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Kubeflow, will make your work and ours a lot easier.




What we’ve prepared for you:




Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarter office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and we equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Scientist / Developer
Description:
Data Scientist / Developer opportunity with an expanding Data Innovation hub in Dublin City centre. Our Client creates a suite of AI products for large enterprises across a diverse portfolio of sectors. They access a wide source of business data from across the globe, which offers a unique opportunity to design, lab-test and trial scalable business solutions in a reliable and secure environment.




This is a unique opportunity to join a growing business and help build and successfully deliver cutting edge AI products and Data and AI services. Its hybrid working from Dublin City Centre office (2-3 days / week)




Salary guide is 80K + 10% Bonus + 5% pension + Health Insurance




Responsibilities

Join the existing DS team and work on new and existing algorithms
Develop NLP and LLM products following a DevOps approach (Agile, Git, Auto Testing and CI/CD etc)
Collaborate on strategic plans to help define new MLAI applications.




Requirements

Strong experience of python data stack such as (numpy, scipy. sklearn, pandas etc)
Experience across the entire data science lifecycle (requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing and deployment)
Experience of ML and analysis techniques for real world use cases
Experience in data modelling.
Experience in Azure DevOps approach to productionization
Experience working with large datasets

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.

By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.

From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.

Job Description

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our growing analytics and AI team. This role will focus on developing Automated Valuation Models (AVM), predictive analytics for urban trends, customer acquisition models, and entity resolution systems.

Responsibilities:



Develop Automated Valuation Models (AVM) for residential and commercial properties using machine learning and statistical modeling.
Conduct data-driven market analysis to assess property trends, demand forecasting, and price fluctuations.
Optimize valuation methodologies using structured and unstructured real estate data.
Design predictive models to analyze urban development trends, economic indicators, and real estate investment opportunities.
Develop customer acquisition models to enhance data-driven marketing strategies and business expansion.
Collaborate with urban planners, real estate analysts, and investment teams to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Implement sustainability-focused models to assess the environmental impact of real estate projects.
Integrate climate, energy efficiency, and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) factors into property valuation frameworks.
Design an entity resolution system to unify and link disparate real estate datasets for improved data quality and analytics.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure robust data pipelines, feature engineering, and data preprocessing workflows.
Manage large-scale datasets from public records, geospatial data, financial reports, and IoT real estate sources.
Work closely with business stakeholders, real estate analysts, and financial teams to align data science initiatives with company objectives.
Present insights, findings, and models to executives and cross-functional teams in an understandable and actionable manner.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:



Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or predictive analytics.
Proficiency in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) or R for data analysis and modeling.
Experience with real estate valuation models, predictive analytics, and econometric modeling.
Strong knowledge of SQL, NoSQL, and big data technologies for handling large-scale datasets.
Familiarity with geospatial data analysis (GIS), time-series forecasting, and NLP for text-based property insights.
Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS) and MLOps best practices.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to translate complex data insights into business-friendly recommendations.
Effective communication and stakeholder management skills for collaboration with technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and drive strategic data initiatives.


Additional Information

Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:



Finance:
Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
Career Development:
Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
Learning Opportunities:
Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
Work-Life Balance:
Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
Health:
Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
Community:
Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


Our diversity makes us stronger - it drives meaningful change and enables us to build innovative technology solutions. We are committed to creating an inclusive community where all of us, regardless of background, identity, or personal characteristics, feels valued, respected, and free from discrimination. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all individuals and base hiring decisions on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.

By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.

From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.

Job Description

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our growing analytics and AI team. This role will focus on developing Automated Valuation Models (AVM), predictive analytics for urban trends, customer acquisition models, and entity resolution systems.

Responsibilities:


  • Develop Automated Valuation Models (AVM) for residential and commercial properties using machine learning and statistical modeling.
  • Conduct data-driven market analysis to assess property trends, demand forecasting, and price fluctuations.
  • Optimize valuation methodologies using structured and unstructured real estate data.
  • Design predictive models to analyze urban development trends, economic indicators, and real estate investment opportunities.
  • Develop customer acquisition models to enhance data-driven marketing strategies and business expansion.
  • Collaborate with urban planners, real estate analysts, and investment teams to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
  • Implement sustainability-focused models to assess the environmental impact of real estate projects.
  • Integrate climate, energy efficiency, and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) factors into property valuation frameworks.
  • Design an entity resolution system to unify and link disparate real estate datasets for improved data quality and analytics.
  • Work closely with data engineers to ensure robust data pipelines, feature engineering, and data preprocessing workflows.
  • Manage large-scale datasets from public records, geospatial data, financial reports, and IoT real estate sources.
  • Work closely with business stakeholders, real estate analysts, and financial teams to align data science initiatives with company objectives.
  • Present insights, findings, and models to executives and cross-functional teams in an understandable and actionable manner.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or predictive analytics.
  • Proficiency in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) or R for data analysis and modeling.
  • Experience with real estate valuation models, predictive analytics, and econometric modeling.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, NoSQL, and big data technologies for handling large-scale datasets.
  • Familiarity with geospatial data analysis (GIS), time-series forecasting, and NLP for text-based property insights.
  • Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS) and MLOps best practices.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Ability to translate complex data insights into business-friendly recommendations.
  • Effective communication and stakeholder management skills for collaboration with technical and non-technical teams.
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and drive strategic data initiatives.

Additional Information

Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:


  • Finance:
    Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
  • Career Development:
    Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
  • Learning Opportunities:
    Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
  • Work-Life Balance:
    Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
  • Health:
    Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
  • Community:
    Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.

Our diversity makes us stronger - it drives meaningful change and enables us to build innovative technology solutions. We are committed to creating an inclusive community where all of us, regardless of background, identity, or personal characteristics, feels valued, respected, and free from discrimination. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all individuals and base hiring decisions on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Scientist

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or AI.
Proficiency in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch);
Strong understanding of statistics, probability, and data modeling.
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Snowflake, etc.).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their ML services.
Experience working with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks).
Familiarity with MLOps, version control (Git), and CI/CD for model deployment.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Fluent in english;
The candidate has to be in Portugal and open to a hybrid position.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Data Scientist - End User - Hybrid Working


  • Realtà di Prodotto Multinazionale con oltre 3500 risorse è alla ricerca di un Data Scientist
  • Modalità ibrida e flessibile: 3 giorni a settimana da remoto garantiti
  • Sede di lavoro: Provincia di Pavia – necessario essere automuniti
  • Budget: 35K


Nel ruolo di Data Scientist avrai l’opportunità di lavorare in un team specializzato, contribuendo allo sviluppo e alla gestione di modelli e processi che ottimizzano i servizi offerti. Opererai in un ambiente dinamico, utilizzando tecniche avanzate di machine learning e deep learning e seguendo approcci agili all’avanguardia.


Responsabilità

  • Collaborare alla gestione e al miglioramento continuo dei progetti di machine learning in essere;
  • Definire le direttive operative e coordinare il lavoro del team incaricato della preparazione dei dati e della verifica dei modelli;
  • Dialogare con analisti ed esperti di settore per identificare opportunità di innovazione tecnologica;
  • Esaminare dati complessi per individuare schemi, trend e relazioni utili a supportare scelte strategiche;
  • Comunicare i risultati delle analisi in modo chiaro ed efficace, semplificandone la comprensione per gli stakeholder aziendali;
  • Integrare le analisi in strumenti e applicazioni interne;
  • Tenersi aggiornati sulle innovazioni tecnologiche e applicarle efficacemente ai progetti aziendali.


Competenze Tecniche Essenziali

  • Laurea magistrale in discipline tecnico-scientifiche (Ingegneria, Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o equivalenti);
  • Conoscenza approfondita della statistica e del machine learning, in particolare applicati al Natural Language Processing;
  • Familiarità con SQL e con i database relazionali;
  • Padronanza di Python e delle librerie principali per la data science e il machine learning (ad es. pandas, scikit-learn);
  • Conoscenza di GIT e della sua applicazione nello sviluppo software;
  • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese.


Plus (almeno uno):

  • Tesi di laurea su tematiche relative al machine learning o alla data science;
  • Esperienza con modelli di intelligenza artificiale generativa (ad es. prompt engineering, RAG, estrazione di informazioni);
  • Esperienza lavorativa di almeno un anno come data scientist;
  • Esperienza con metodologie agili (ad es. Scrum, XP);
  • Conoscenza di Linux e della shell per operazioni di base (ad es. gestione file, configurazione servizi, SSH);
  • Esperienza con lo sviluppo basato su test (Test Driven Development);
  • Familiarità con la programmazione orientata agli oggetti e con i principi SOLID;
  • Competenze nell’uso di reti neurali e di framework come TensorFlow o PyTorch.


Cosa offriamo

  • Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e informale, con flessibilità oraria.
  • Ore settimanali dedicate alla formazione, con partecipazione a eventi e conferenze.
  • Pacchetto welfare strutturato a sostegno delle esigenze personali e familiari.
  • Sede moderna e sostenibile in provincia di Pavia (a metà tra Pavia e Milano) immersa nel verde, con mensa interna e palestra aziendale.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - AI, Machine Learning & Automation
Description:
Sei un mago dei dati? Ti entusiasma l'idea di addestrare modelli di AI come fossero Pokémon? Allora, abbiamo la missione perfetta per te! 💡✨Perché scegliere INGO?


Perché abbiamo bisogno di cervelli brillanti: la tua visione innovativa e fuori dagli schemi potrebbe essere la chiave per rivoluzionare il nostro modo di lavorare!
Perché facciamo del bene alla biosfera: ci piace innovare con un impatto positivo.
Perché la flessibilità è il nostro mantra: smart working, uffici innovativi e un weekend che dura più di due giorni (sì, hai letto bene!).
Perché siamo ovunque: con diverse sedi in Italia, avrai la possibilità di viaggiare e scoprire tutte le nostre realtà.
Perché qui l’innovazione è di casa: lavoriamo in team e collaboriamo per creare soluzioni che fanno la differenza.



Cosa farai? 👨‍💻🤖Ti unirai al nostro team Automation e lavorerai fianco a fianco con altri data scientist e sviluppatori per:


Analizzare e interpretare dati per scovare nuove opportunità di automazione aziendale.
Sviluppare modelli predittivi e classificatori utilizzando tecniche avanzate di machine learning e AI.
Estrarre insight e pattern nascosti all’interno dei dati per migliorare i nostri servizi.



💡 Vuoi vedere cosa abbiamo già realizzato? Dai un’occhiata ai nostri progetti:


Autoguidovie
AI Reception in ambito healthcare
Virgin Active



Cosa cerchiamo in te? ✅ Laurea in Statistica, Informatica, Ingegneria o un campo simile.

✅ Esperienza nella programmazione, preferibilmente in Python.

✅ Familiarità con tecniche di machine learning e analisi dati.

✅ Conoscenza di metodologie statistiche avanzate.

✅ Inglese B2 (perché l’AI non parla solo italiano!).

✅ Ottime capacità comunicative e di lavoro in team.🚀 Nice to have: esperienza con automazione di processi aziendali. Dove lavorerai?📍 La nostra sede è a Paderno Dugnano (MI), Via I Maggio 13, ma adottiamo una modalità ibrida tra ufficio e smart working.Se pensi di avere la stoffa giusta e credi che l'innovazione, il rispetto e l'autenticità siano la chiave del successo... allora TI VOGLIAMO NEL TEAM! 🚀💥

L'annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi dell'Art. 27 del D.Lgs. 198/2006.

👉 Candidati ora!
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - AI Inteligencia Artificial
Description:
The Digital Business Team develops promising digital solutions for global products and processes. It aims to organize Applus+ Laboratories' information, making it useful, fast, and reliable for both the Applus+ Group and its clients. The team’s mission is to be recognized as the most digital, innovative, and customer-oriented company, reducing digital operations' costs while increasing the value and portfolio of services.




We are looking for a Data Science / AI Engineer to join our Digital team and contribute to the development of evolving data products and applications.




What are we are looking for?

Collect, organize, and analyze information to generate code, train models, verify and validate outputs, and draw meaningful conclusions.
Have strong mathematical fundamentals and be proficient in numerical and statistical methods, as well as a variety of machine learning algorithms.
Bring expertise in NLP and foundation models, with specific knowledge in transformers, tokenization, and encoding-decoding processes.
Apply Explainable AI methodologies and use related Python libraries (e.g., SHAP, LIME).
Demonstrate organized thinking, strong logic and reasoning skills, and effective communication, ensuring knowledge sharing through documentation and well-commented code.
Possess a keen eye for detail to identify anomalies in data and code.
Exhibit creativity and an "out-of-the-box" approach to problem-solving.




Requirements:

Demonstrated experience coding in python specifically working in data science projects and using ML most common libraries.
2+ year experience in ML / AI projects.
Strong knowledge in machine learning / deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Specific knowledge on Computer Linguistics may be an advantage: NLP libraries like Spacy or NLTK, genAI frameworks such as LangChain and/or LlamaIndex, chunking, tokenization, embeddings...
Specific expertness on foundation models will be considered.
Previous experiences working with Generative AI and explainable AI are welcome.




Our current tech stack is:

Python
Commonly used ML/AI libraries
Azure AI
Java




Technical Requirements

Proven coding experience (e.g., Python; other languages are a plus) in data science projects and familiarity with common ML libraries.
Hands-on experience in ML/AI projects (preferred).
Solid knowledge of data mining, machine learning, and deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Familiarity with computer linguistics: NLP libraries (e.g., SpaCy, NLTK), generative AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex), tokenization, embeddings, and chunking.
Expertise in foundation models and previous work with Generative AI and Explainable AI is an advantage.

Education

Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
A master’s degree in Data Science or AI Engineering is an advantage.

Languages

Fluent in Spanish and English.




If you are passionate about neural networks, advanced AI algorithms, and challenging yourself, this is the right job for you!

Title: Junior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (Cologne)
Company: Zero to One Search | Recruitment Agency
Description:
Junior Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Cologne, hybrid

Contract: Permanent




Are you interested in the next big challenge?

Our client is a big (2k employees in all major cities in Germany) company with several digital products and services on the market that make easier daily life of their customers.

You will find the dynamics of e-commerce, agile processes, flat hierarchies and steep development curves.

Now they are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer with a strong interest in building end-to-end solutions.







Requirements:




Good degree, e.g. in data science, (business) informatics, mathematics, physics or statistics
First practical professional experience in data science projects, preferably with first insights into ranking and recommendation systems
Sound knowledge of the Python data science stack (Pandas, SKLearn, SciPy) as well as experience with deep learning frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow)
Creativity and curiosity in applying the latest algorithms from the field of data science to optimize their products
Motivation for interdisciplinary work between IT and product management and for knowledge exchange within the company’s Data Science Community
Very good written and spoken German and English skills




Responsibilities:




You are significantly involved in setting up a data science department, automating related business processes and delivering individually tailored results to the customers
You create new machine learning services with a focus on recommendation and ranking systems, information extraction and predictions, including conceptual design, data preparation, model training and evaluation, and subsequent preparation for go-live
You manage your training experiments with modern MLOps frameworks such as MLFlow and help to take the product to the next level
You integrate your models into the product both in terms of content and technology, using cloud technologies (AWS) for example and in close cooperation with the development team
You keep yourself up to date with the latest developments in machine learning and think with your team about how you can use generative AI models such as Transformers or ChatGPT, for example
You work in a cross-disciplinary team in direct cooperation with product managers, developers and business intelligence managers




Benefits:




Flexible working time model with four days per week in the office and one day flexibly from the office or from home.
Personal growth: they support your development with further training and regular feedback meetings to recognize and develop your strengths and potential.
Open-ended contracts with an attractive and performance-oriented salary package including annual bonuses. As well as fitness cooperations, subsidized company bicycle leasing, etc.
Independent, agile work in small teams with a strong team spirit. Short decision-making processes.
An ergonomic workplace with modern equipment, including two additional screens and height-adjustable desks, from your first day at work.

And much more.

Benefits:


  • Flexible working time model with four days per week in the office and one day flexibly from the office or from home.
  • Personal growth: they support your development with further training and regular feedback meetings to recognize and develop your strengths and potential.
  • Open-ended contracts with an attractive and performance-oriented salary package including annual bonuses. As well as fitness cooperations, subsidized company bicycle leasing, etc.
  • Independent, agile work in small teams with a strong team spirit. Short decision-making processes.
  • An ergonomic workplace with modern equipment, including two additional screens and height-adjustable desks, from your first day at work.

And much more.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ciao, talento del tech! 🌟

Siamo MatchGuru, piacere di conoscerti!




Ci presentiamo, come è giusto che sia 🤝

MatchGuru è più di una piattaforma: è l'epicentro dove talenti e aziende si scoprono, capiscono e incontrano. Un mix (già leggendario) di tecnologia e competenza, progettato per match che vanno oltre l'eccellenza. Con le nostre soluzioni tecnologiche proprietarie, acceleriamo ed efficientiamo il processo di selezione, liberandolo da rallentamenti ed errori. Questo ci rende anche una vera e propria guida per talenti, che accompagniamo verso le opportunità più affini alle proprie caratteristiche e aspettative.




Cosa ci facciamo qui 👀

Oltre a garantire match perfetti a te, aiutiamo in tutti i modi le aziende a scovare i talenti più affini al proprio DNA, assicurando una perfetta compatibilità di skill, aspettative, aspirazioni e valori. Vogliamo assicurare soddisfazione e gratificazione sia ai talenti, che alle aziende.




⭐ L’opportunità :

Posizione: Data Scientist
Seniority: 1-2 anni
Dove: Bari, modalità ibrida




💼Le tue responsabilità...

Come Data Scientist, svilupperai e ottimizzerai prodotti di intelligenza artificiale, occupandoti dell’intero ciclo di analisi, dai dati ai modelli predittivi. Collaborerai con il Backend Developer per rendere i modelli accessibili ai clienti, inizialmente concentrandoti su Orchestra. Il tuo contributo avrà un impatto economico e ambientale significativo.




💡Potresti fare match con questa posizione se hai…

Ottima conoscenza di Python e dei principali pacchetti di data science (Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib).
Esperienza in machine learning con TensorFlow o PyTorch.
Conoscenza di MLops per il deployment e la gestione di modelli ML in cloud.
Esperienza in ricerca applicata alla modellistica predittiva e analitica.
Solide basi di sviluppo software, best practices e scrittura di codice documentato e mantenibile.




💶 Ma andiamo al sodo: ecco cosa ti offrono

Inserimento con contratto a Tempo Indeterminato
Range RAL: fino a 28 K
Buoni pasto da 8 euro
Welfare aziendale







Se pensi di essere il match perfetto per questa opportunità o conosci qualcuno che potrebbe esserlo, candidati subito oppure contattaci! 📩

Proviamo a matchare? 🚀




N.B. Ricorda di esplicitare nel CV il tuo consenso al trattamento dei dati personali, ai sensi del D.LGS. 196/03. La ricerca è egualmente rivolta a donne e uomini, in accordo con la normativa vigente (L.903/77).

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Remote, Contract)
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it’s decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


INFUSE is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy

We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our Research and Development (R&D) team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing analytical solutions for complex problems that cannot be solved using simple algorithms or traditional code. You will work on a variety of cutting-edge projects, including data-driven insights, predictive modeling, machine learning, and optimization. This is an exciting opportunity to apply your skills in a dynamic R&D environment and contribute to the development of next-generation solutions.

Responsibilities:


Defining Problem-Solving Approaches:
Analyze business problems, formulate hypotheses, and propose methods for testing them.
Develop and test technologies for data analysis and decision-making automation.
Data Management:
Organize data collection, cleaning, and structuring for further analysis.
Define necessary data requirements and collaborate with the team on data preparation.
Model Development & Machine Learning:
Design, build, and validate machine learning models to address business problems and improve product performance.
Develop predictive models, recommendation systems, and classification algorithms to solve complex challenges.
Optimize models, test them on real-world data, and assess the quality of solutions.
Reporting & Solution Integration:
Primary task: Automate processes, including data collection and processing, optimization of existing processes, and acceleration of system performance.
Prepare reports with analysis results, including metrics to evaluate hypothesis effectiveness.
Work closely with product managers and business analysts, helping them understand potential limitations and risks during implementation.
Automation & AI Models:
Use generative and specialized neural networks to automate processes.
Optimize AI model prompts for better interaction.
Seek pre-built solutions for accelerating workflows while ensuring deep understanding of neural network fine-tuning.
Data-Driven Research & Innovation:
Collaborate with the R&D team to explore new research areas and apply data science techniques to support innovative product development.
Conduct experiments and hypothesis testing to validate assumptions and optimize models.
Collaboration & Cross-Functional Work:
Work closely with product managers, engineers, and other team members to align data-driven solutions with business goals.
Contribute to team knowledge-sharing, ensuring that data science best practices are adopted across the organization.
Continuous Learning & Innovation:
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
Integrate new techniques into R&D projects and experiment with new tools and technologies.

Key Qualifications:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, with a strong focus on machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analysis.
Strong knowledge of data science techniques, including regression, clustering, classification, and time-series analysis.
Expertise in machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch).
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar, and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).
Familiarity with big data tools and platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.
Solid understanding of data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Tableau, PowerBI) to communicate insights effectively.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large and complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, manage projects, and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Ukrainian or Russian language knowledge is a must.


We offer:


Opportunity to work on innovative and cutting-edge projects in a fast-paced R&D environment.
Professional development and career growth opportunities.
Competitive compensation in USD.
Professional, friendly, and dynamic team atmosphere.
Schedule: Monday to Friday 14:00 - 23:00 EET (incl. 1 hr break)
Paid vacation and sick-leaves. Reduced Fridays during the summer.
Employee development budget for courses, certifications, and conferences.
Access to the latest tools and technologies.
Opportunity to contribute to the company’s growth and innovation.


Our hiring process:


Interview with the recruiter;
Technical interview;
Call with a hiring manager;
Offer.


If you feel like this opportunity aligns with your experience and expectations, please don't hesitate to apply!

Title: Data Scientist Confirmé - H/F - CDI
Description:
Company Description

Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data.

Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.

Présent sur cinq continents, dans 20 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui compte plus de 7100 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros à fin 2024, et ambitionne de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.

Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable.

En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’Innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société.

Job Description

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un Data Scientist capable de participer à des projets techniques Data Science et IA. Vous devrez faire preuve d’un état d’esprit à la fois innovant, méthodique, orienté solution (et non problème!), et communiquant.

Votre but ultime sera de garantir l’excellence de vos solutions Data Science/IA, pièces maitresses de la réalisation de projets disruptifs pour nos clients.

VOTRE ROLE SUR NOS PROJETS:


En mission: analyse des besoins métiers, définition des principes et méthodes de collecte et de traitement des données, choix des modèles de Machine Learning ou de Deep Learning, mise en application des techniques de traitement et de visualisation de la data, restitution des analyses et résultats obtenus auprès des métiers et des sponsors
Partager techniquement les membres de l’équipe: solutions et code reviews, recommandations, certifications à réaliser, …
Participation à des meet-up, coding dogo,…
Communication: écriture d’articles, retours d’expérience…


VOTRE ROLE CHEZ TALAN :


Benchmark de solutions et conseil auprès de nos clients sur les solutions technologiques à adopter, en lien avec leurs besoins
Réalisation de POC (Proof Of Concept)
Participation à des projets internes et partage de connaissances au sein de nos équipes.
Partage de connaissances et formations interne


#TalanFrance

Qualifications

VOTRE PROFIL:


Issu d’une formation Grande École d’Ingénieur/Doctorant, spécialisée en Data Science ou Intelligence Artificielle
Vous disposez d’au moins 3 années d’expérience dans le domaine
Maitrise des techniques d’analyses statistiques, de modélisations prédictives, de Machine Learning, de Deep Learning,...
Maitrise des techniques de data management et de DataViz
Maitrise de Python, R, RShiny, SQL…
Maitrise de l’utilisation des outils DevOps: Git, Docker, Jenkins/Nexus,…
Bonnes connaissances Big Data: pySpark, Spark, NoSQL…
Connaissance d’outils tels que Dataiku, AWS SageMaker, Azure ML,…
Autonomie, organisation, sens du partage
Excellente communication
Orientation métier


Additional Information

AVANTAGES :


Plan de formation pour accompagner votre carrière (formations éditeurs, certifications) grâce à nos partenariats nous accordant une position de partenaire privilégié, et management de proximité par des experts
Locaux modernes en centre-ville
Top 5 du Palmarès Great Place to Work
Télétravail jusqu’à 5 jours selon les missions, prime d’équipement de 100€
Mobilité en France et à l’étranger
Top 1% des entreprises évaluées par Ecovadis dans le domaine social, environnemental et éthique
Tickets restaurant, prime vacances, 50% transport (abonnement transport public), mutuelle
Permanence handicap (consultant dédié aux collaborateurs en situation de handicap et aux proches aidants)
Actionnariat salarié
Prime de cooptations
RTT


PROCESS RECRUTEMENT:

L’équipe recrutement s’engage à vous proposer un processus de recrutement rapide et fluide


1 entretien RHpar Teams (45min)
1 test technique
1 entretien opérationnel avec le responsable de domaine, au siège (1heure)
1 entretien avec le directeur de pôle, au siège(1heure)
Show more

  • Top 1% des entreprises évaluées par Ecovadis dans le domaine social, environnemental et éthique
  • Tickets restaurant, prime vacances, 50% transport (abonnement transport public), mutuelle
  • Permanence handicap (consultant dédié aux collaborateurs en situation de handicap et aux proches aidants)
  • Actionnariat salarié
  • Prime de cooptations
  • RTT

PROCESS RECRUTEMENT:

L’équipe recrutement s’engage à vous proposer un processus de recrutement rapide et fluide

  • 1 entretien RHpar Teams (45min)
  • 1 test technique
  • 1 entretien opérationnel avec le responsable de domaine, au siège (1heure)
  • 1 entretien avec le directeur de pôle, au siège(1heure)

Work closely with product managers, engineers, and other team members to align data-driven solutions with business goals.
Contribute to team knowledge-sharing, ensuring that data science best practices are adopted across the organization.
Continuous Learning & Innovation:
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
Integrate new techniques into R&D projects and experiment with new tools and technologies.

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, with a strong focus on machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analysis.

Solid understanding of data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Tableau, PowerBI) to communicate insights effectively.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large and complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Ukrainian or Russian language knowledge is a must.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Test Intro

Join one of the fastest growing rewards/fintech startups in the world - Benjamin! Backed by Play Ventures and F4 Fund, we're all about making everyday actions rewarding. We're looking for an experienced Data Scientist to help us take things to the next level.

At Benjamin, we give users real cash rewards—what we call MoMos (Money Moments)—for things they're already doing. From playing games and watching ads to everyday card purchases with cash back, we're all about putting money back in people's pockets.

Key Responsibilities:


Lead and conduct comprehensive investigations into the virtual economy and products, employing hypothesis-driven insights and experimentation methods.
Design and implement data science workflows, including experimental design and key statistical methods.
Communicate complex topics effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Utilize statistical programming languages (R, Python, Julia) and SQL to analyze data.
Leverage data engineering tools (dbt, Spark, Snowflake) to manage and process large datasets.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a culture of growth through teaching and knowledge sharing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive business outcomes.
Develop intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, using tools like Hex, Looker, Tableau, or Mixpanel.
Continuously seek out new ideas and data sources, applying a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach to solve ambiguous problems.


Qualifications


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in analytics or data science positions.
Deep understanding of statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing and experimentation.
Proficiency in statistical programming languages (R, Python, Julia) and SQL.
Familiarity with data engineering tools such as dbt, Spark, and Snowflake.
Expertise in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards with tools like Hex, Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Strong communication skills for explaining complex topics.
Passion for mentoring team members and recognizing teaching as a pathway to growth.
Background in gaming and knowledge of the free-to-play business model preferred; similar experience in related industries is also valued.


Modeling Skills:

Extensive experience in developing and implementing:


Predictive Models: Utilizing techniques like regression analysis, time-series forecasting, and ensemble methods.
Machine Learning Algorithms: Designing and deploying algorithms such as decision trees, random forests, gradient boosting, neural networks, and clustering techniques.
Statistical Models: Conducting statistical analysis using methods such as ANOVA, hypothesis testing, and Bayesian inference.


Ideal Candidate:


Proven track record in the virtual economy and products.
Experience in the entertainment or platform industry.
Ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Why Join Us?


Competitive pay: We offer great salaries and bonuses.
Thriving in Hyper-Growth: Immerse yourself in the dynamic environment of a hyper-growth startup, where you'll encounter daily challenges and avenues for professional advancement.
Cutting-Edge Collaboration: Engage with innovative technology and join a fast-paced team known for its forward-thinking approach and commitment to innovation.
Positive Workplace Culture: Experience a professional yet enjoyable atmosphere, where hard work is valued alongside a sense of humor and camaraderie, fostering a fulfilling work environment.


About Benjamin

Benjamin is reshaping the future of cash rewards with a simple idea: everyday actions should earn you cash. Whether you're making a purchase, playing a mobile game, or watching an ad, you get rewarded with Benjamin Money Moments. It's that simple.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Test Conclusion

HTML:
Test Intro

Join one of the fastest growing rewards/fintech startups in the world - Benjamin! Backed by Play Ventures and F4 Fund, we're all about making everyday actions rewarding. We're looking for an experienced Data Scientist to help us take things to the next level.

At Benjamin, we give users real cash rewards—what we call MoMos (Money Moments)—for things they're already doing. From playing games and watching ads to everyday card purchases with cash back, we're all about putting money back in people's pockets.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and conduct comprehensive investigations into the virtual economy and products, employing hypothesis-driven insights and experimentation methods.
  • Design and implement data science workflows, including experimental design and key statistical methods.
  • Communicate complex topics effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Utilize statistical programming languages (R, Python, Julia) and SQL to analyze data.
  • Leverage data engineering tools (dbt, Spark, Snowflake) to manage and process large datasets.
  • Mentor and guide team members, fostering a culture of growth through teaching and knowledge sharing.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive business outcomes.
  • Develop intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, using tools like Hex, Looker, Tableau, or Mixpanel.
  • Continuously seek out new ideas and data sources, applying a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach to solve ambiguous problems.

Qualifications

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in analytics or data science positions.
  • Deep understanding of statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing and experimentation.
  • Proficiency in statistical programming languages (R, Python, Julia) and SQL.
  • Familiarity with data engineering tools such as dbt, Spark, and Snowflake.
  • Expertise in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
  • Experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards with tools like Hex, Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Strong communication skills for explaining complex topics.
  • Passion for mentoring team members and recognizing teaching as a pathway to growth.
  • Background in gaming and knowledge of the free-to-play business model preferred; similar experience in related industries is also valued.

Modeling Skills:

Extensive experience in developing and implementing:

  • Predictive Models: Utilizing techniques like regression analysis, time-series forecasting, and ensemble methods.
  • Machine Learning Algorithms: Designing and deploying algorithms such as decision trees, random forests, gradient boosting, neural networks, and clustering techniques.
  • Statistical Models: Conducting statistical analysis using methods such as ANOVA, hypothesis testing, and Bayesian inference.

Ideal Candidate:

  • Proven track record in the virtual economy and products.
  • Experience in the entertainment or platform industry.
  • Ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.

Why Join Us?

  • Competitive pay: We offer great salaries and bonuses.
  • Thriving in Hyper-Growth: Immerse yourself in the dynamic environment of a hyper-growth startup, where you'll encounter daily challenges and avenues for professional advancement.
  • Cutting-Edge Collaboration: Engage with innovative technology and join a fast-paced team known for its forward-thinking approach and commitment to innovation.
  • Positive Workplace Culture: Experience a professional yet enjoyable atmosphere, where hard work is valued alongside a sense of humor and camaraderie, fostering a fulfilling work environment.

About Benjamin

Benjamin is reshaping the future of cash rewards with a simple idea: everyday actions should earn you cash. Whether you're making a purchase, playing a mobile game, or watching an ad, you get rewarded with Benjamin Money Moments. It's that simple.

Title: Data scientist & IA Ops - H/F
Description:
Lincoln Pure Player Data 💡: Depuis 30 ans, nous réinventons l'analyse des données en accompagnant les grandes entreprises dans leur transformation digitale. Experts en Modern BI, Big Data et Science des Données, nous intervenons dans divers secteurs tels que la banque, le retail, les télécoms, l'industrie et la santé.




5 ans d'expérience minimum




Description du poste




🎯 Missions :




Mettre en place et optimiser des pipelines de déploiement CI/CD pour automatiser et industrialiser le cycle de vie des modèles IA.
Gérer le déploiement, la scalabilité et la maintenance des modèles IA en production avec Kubernetes et Docker.
Assurer la fiabilité, la sécurité et la surveillance des infrastructures dédiées à l'IA et la Data Science.
Collaborer avec les Data Scientists et les ingénieurs MLOps pour intégrer efficacement les modèles dans un environnement cloud/hybride.
Améliorer l'architecture des plateformes Data & IA en adoptant les meilleures pratiques DevOps et MLOps.
Optimiser la gestion des données et la performance des modèles dans un contexte de production.




🛡️ Prérequis :




Expérience pratique dans le déploiement et l'industrialisation de modèles IA en production.
Maîtrise de Python et des outils DevOps/MLOps tels que Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD).
Compétences avancées en gestion d'infrastructure cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) et sur des solutions de monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
Connaissance des frameworks de Machine Learning et Data Science (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Expérience avec des bases de données SQL/NoSQL et des outils de gestion de flux de données.
Capacité à travailler en équipe, résolution de problèmes et forte autonomie.




🌟 Avantages :




Environnement dynamique et innovant.
Formations certifiantes et accompagnement personnalisé.
Possibilité de télétravail et horaires flexibles.
Rémunération attractive avec avantages sociaux compétitifs.
Mobilité possible à Lille, Lyon ou Aix-en-Provence.




✨ Processus de recrutement : Deux entretiens (RH et technique).




Si vous êtes passionné par les défis du Data & IA Ops et souhaitez rejoindre une équipe experte et engagée, postulez dès maintenant et participez à la transformation des données chez Lincoln ! 😉
